intro: Polytrema aequale, commonly known as the common spurge, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows up to 60 cm in height. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which is characterized by the presence of latex and unique floral structures. Polytrema aequale is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
